name: Ava, The Party Elf ( Bard 26 / Shadowdancer 13 / Ranger 1)
author: Roxiee

posts.author: Roxiee
posts.content:
It's almost Christmas and my house is filled with Yuletide music every single day so I thought to share my Christmas build (and a build I've been playing for a couple of months now).  She is someone who embraces the spirit of PARTYING.  She also tries to keep the spirit of Christmas alive by GIVING, which only means she's a support build (is there any other?).  

I actually have a more serious story for her called Shadow of Calliope, but with Christmas looming, I thought what the hell.  

I introduce you all to Ava.  She's the perfect Party Elf, or in this case, CHRISTMAS ELF - someone who gets invited to all the office and neighborhood Christmas parties.

---

What Ava brings to the CHRISTMAS PARTY:
1.  Classic Christmas songs to bring the party to life (Level 21 Bard Song).

2.  Any Justin Beaver song to assault your enemies' senses (Level 22 Curse Song).

3.  Unparalleled, interracial FLIRTING (56 unbuffed Taunt) to catch your foes off-guard, and make casters fumble because we all know that every wickedly powerful wizard is a nervous adolescent deep inside (-6 AC max, 30% spell failure).

4.  Can DJ all night long (Lasting Inspiration).

5.  HiPS.  Yes, yes, Ava's got the curves...but I'm talking about sneaking here.  Yup, she can do both.

6.  Gossip!  Because we all need to know that Dai-Vyd is getting boobs due to his wife Llora adding a strange concoction to his morning drink after finding out that he's sleeping with the artificer next door, whose alchemist brother has been secretly scrying them but has been caught by Llora because his window was open during market day of all days(!), and has been coerced into brewing the said concoction (31 unbuffed Listen, 60 with Amplify and Bard Song).


Ava's other talents:
1.  Still Spell (in a DEX BARD?!)
 -  Quality of life.  She CAN wear leather and shield so the ability to buff without stripping and cast during battle is a godsend.  This is especially useful when adventuring since you want to use low duration buffs such as Amplify, Haste, Improved Invi and War Cry only when needed, which is usually during an encounter.
 -  Spell slot flexibility.  No rogue?  Ava can have 8 Find Traps.  Consigned to counterspelling?  She can have the Dispel line of spells up to level 6.  Healer?  She can during battle, and if she's wearing robes, she can have 8 Cure Criticals and 8 Healing Circles.  In high magic modules where majority of her buffs become obsolete, this flexibility gets her better mileage on her spellcasting.
*** If you play in a PW, you can pick Craft Wand instead.  I play on modules with friends so XP is a commodity.

2.  Undispellable (except for Mord's).
3.  Epic Dodge
4.  Immediate detection of non-epic traps at level 18.
5.  Disarm Traps with DC < 36 at level 24 with Bard Song | at level 13 with +6 INT & Bard Song | at level 18 with +4 INT & Bard Song.
6.  UMD


What Ava is SAD about:
1.  8 STR.  Low carry weight.  Low damage.
2.  Low health,  from all the late-night partying probably.
3.  3 attacks per round.
4.  Low unbuffed AB (37)
5.  Dependent on UMD and Bard Song for damage.
6.  Low Fort (21) and Will (20)saves.
7.  No active combat feats (KD/IKD, Expertise/IE).


Ava's Spells:
Level 1:  Amplify, Identify, Lesser Dispel, Mage Armor, Protection from Alignment | Magic Weapon for Lesser Dispel (until you get GMW)
Level 2:  Bull's Strength, Cat's Grace, Darkness, Ghostly visage, Ultravision
Level 3:  Dispel Magic, Find Traps, GMW, Haste, Displacement
Level 4:  Cure Critical Wounds, Dismissal, Improved Invisibility, Neutralize Poison, War Cry
Level 5:  Ethereal Visage, Greater Dispelling, Healing Circle, Mind Fog, Summon Creature V
Level 6:  Dirge, Energy Buffer, Ice Storm, Mass Haste


Builder's Comments:
I couldn't find a DEX-based, "pure" Bard in our guild that sang to me so I thought to try my hand at it.  I was looking for 2 things:  First is early Lasting Inspiration and Epic Dodge because I don't want to wait until level 40 to be 100% complete at my role (or enjoy the "full" build).  The second is the ability to play well in any party composition so she can fill the gaps when needed.

I was able to achieve both requirements in my first draft, and got LI and ED at levels 27 and 30 respectively.  However, I wasn't satisfied with the feat and skill point distribution since I had to constrict myself to getting LI and ED on those levels.  Other problems I encountered are arcane spell failure from using Leather + Shield, AND lack of spell slots/duration for my key buffs (especially if resting is restricted).

These factors led me to redesign and come up with the final version.  I adjusted the stats to get rid of Toughness and replace it with a spell feat for better slot management (originally Extend Spell, but I decided that Still Spell would have more universal applications).  This version also allowed me to take more ESFs at key stages of leveling to ensure that Ava's skills are always relevant.  This comes at the expense of 1 AB and Epic Dodge coming in at level 36 (6 levels late).  Being a dexer with HiPS + buffs can definitely help with the late ED, and -1 AB in a Taunt build isn't significant.

I'm quite happy with the end result - a support character who can solo, and has enough tricks to cover gaps in a party.  I'm also confident that in a group with multiple bards - with a 16/4 pre-epic split and skill/feat distribution - she's ALMOST always gonna have the most potent Bard Song when leveling,  while still making her playable. 

Of course, I submit this to the wise builders of our guild to help me improve Ava even more.

---

There are no builds in the guild with the exact class distribution, which probably means there are inherent problems with the build or is outclassed by a similar concept.  Ava felt fun to play and was easier to solo than I expected - so if anyone can let me know why no one bothered with this (or maybe I didn't search hard enough?), that would be insightful.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Gotta love this charmer!
A fine and tested build and a great presentation highlighting several of the talents of the bard class.

If you search for bard 26+ builds with epic dodge, it would surprise me if nothing with SD shows up. The single level of ranger is just a neat trick to squeeze in an extra feat, I assume.
I'm curious if it would be possible to achieve an equal build by going bard 29/ SD 10/ ranger 1?

posts.author: Roxiee
posts.content:
Thank you Mick!  I'm having fun running her in a party right now.

I used the old Epic Character Search Engine (https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... index.html) which, you'd be surprised to know, only has 7 results for 26 Bard and any SD - with only 1 of them having Epic Dodge, and it majors in Bard and Rogue.  I also searched here, but I must admit I did my search in the Finalized Build section.  I found one using a quick search in the Build Request:  Aquarius' The Inspiring Dodger (Ba20/CoT10/SD10) but it takes LI very late for my tastes, plus it has fewer skillpoints.

As for Ranger - yes it is for that extra feat, although that started as Pale Master to emulate Armor Skin.  But then I realized it doesn't fit the character, and that's when I found Ranger which fits the RP, and was even better because of the level 1 bonus - Trackless Step (+4 to Hide and MS when outdoors)!

Ba29/ SD10/ Ra1 has 6 less HP and 6 less skill points - which surprised me since I thought Bards had more skill points than SD but apparently that isn't the case.  I tested that too because my original was Ba30 / SD10, but when I realized that I didn't want all the Great Dexes, I decided to slowly trim down the Bard levels until I ended up with the current split.

posts.author: Roxiee
posts.content:
KD is there for a consistent source of sneak attacks. If you find yourself missing even after buffs, use Taunt and Curse Song to get up to +11 to 12AB (translated from -11 to 12AC on your opponent).

Still Spell is there since you can wear leather armor which are usually better than robes, AC-wise. And leather incurs 5% arcane failure so you need Still Spell to get around that. Shields also add more to that with 5%, 15% and 50% for small, large and tower shields respectively. Don't expect you to wear tower btw, that will take a lot from your carrying capacity!

But the best use of Still Spell there is really spellbook management so you can cast your favorite spells at another spell slot. Imagine having Displacement (not affected by arcane failure) at level 3 and 4, stilled! Or Improved Invi at level 5, stilled, so you can cast on demand due to the short duration instead of running around with it. These are especially useful in rest-restricted modules!

And 36 UMD since unbuffed, your level 26 Bard song gives you + 9 to skills. That gives you 45 UMD to have access to restricted gear especially in high magic worlds.

Oh and she's a dexer with low STR and only 37 base AB so you will need to use the tricks available to her during leveling. If you're accustomed to playing straight-up fighters, esp STR-based ones, you might find yourself frustated in her teens ;)
